p: Wistar rats and Swiss albino mice were provided from the local colonies of the department of biology (Faculty of Sciences-Oujda, Morocco), they were placed under standard conditions (23°C ± 2°C and 12 h light-dark cycle), and they were allowed to free access of water and food. All animals were cared for in compliance with the internationally accepted guide for the care and use of laboratory animals, published by the US National Institutes of Health (NIH Publication No. 85-23, Revised in 1985).
